This taught me something: The importance of a road is not its current route; it is its destination. Two roads can look quite similar and even run side by side for a time, but their signposts tell you where they are leading, and people choose the road based on these signposts.

After a time, the two train lines would diverge and go to completely different cities, many miles apart. And indeed, when people bought tickets for these trains, they bought tickets not because they had any interest in the route. They were only interested in the destination.
